articles.content:
Cuban Embassy Officials Visit Exhibition of Works on Juche Idea 
   Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- Cuban Ambassador to the DPRK Ruben Perez Valdes and embassy officials visited the Exhibition of Works on the Juche Idea on August 21 on the occasion of the month of solidarity with the Cuban people.
 The guests looked round with keen interest the works and data on display, being briefed on the facts that President Kim Il Sung founded the Juche idea, Kim Jong Il deepened and developed the idea with his ideological and theoretical activities and they, peerlessly great men, wrote a great number of works to make immortal contributions to the accomplishment of the human cause of independence.    
 They also visited King Tangun's Mausoleum. They went round stone sculptures and the chambers of the mausoleum, being briefed on the precious cultural treasure which proves the long history and homogeneity of the Korean nation.

Conservative Gangsters' Violence Denounced in S. Korea
articles.content:
Stop to S. Korea-U.S. Military Exercises Called for in S. Korea 
   Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- 71 civic and social organizations of south Korea including the South Headquarters of the National Alliance for the Country's Reunification, the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification and the Anti-U.S. Women's Society reportedly called a press conference in the vicinity of the U.S. embassy in Seoul on August 18 to demand a stop to the south Korea-U.S. joint military exercises.
 A press release demanding a stop to the "Ulji Focus Lens" joint military exercises which call for a war was read out at the press conference. The release said that the joint military exercises to be staged from Monday are aimed at training the control of the crisis of south Korea-U.S. combined forces in case of emergency in the Korean Peninsula, reorganization of all work on a war footing and procedure of cooperation of the south Korea-U.S. combined forces and estimating and rounding off the deploying capacity of U.S. reinforcements.    
 It can not but be an undisguised military pressure upon the north that the joint military exercises are being launched in the Korean Peninsula at the time when conflict between the north and the U.S. is being aggravated and the U.S. economic blockade against the north is surfacing, the release noted, stressing if the U.S. and the south Korean "government" truly want peace on the Korean Peninsula, they should stop the aggressive military drills.
